Section.title: Overview
Section.Paragraph: The brooklime package provides a command-line interface for performing tasks such as creating, closing, releasing, listing, and examining Nexus staging repositories. The base brooklime command is broken into a number of subcommands which are documented over the following sections.

All subcommands accept a --verbose parameter that may be set to one of trace, debug, info, warn, or error. This parameter sets the lower bound for the severity of messages that will be logged. For example, at debug verbosity, only messages of severity debug and above will be logged. Setting verbosity to trace level effectively causes everything to be logged, and will produce large volumes of debugging output.

All subcommands, unless otherwise specified, yield an exit code of 0 on success, and a non-zero exit code on failure.
